page.title: 01A GENERAL DESCRIPTION. .
page.content: Lytham was first mentioned in the Domesday book, as {"Lidum,"}having 240 acres of cultivatable land. It is situated at the estuary of the River Ribble. Lytham is a small town, mostly residential, with many retired people. The population is about 19,000. There are a few small industries on the eastern side as well as the Land Registry Offices for the North West Region.To the North is an agricultural area with mixed and Dairy farming. For centuries Lytham was dominated by the Clifton family of Lytham Hall,but the Hall and its estate were sold to the Guardian Royal Exchange Assurance Company in 1960.To the West of Lytham is the holiday centre of St.Annes.In 1922 Lytham and St.Annes were joined in one borough and they are still together as part of Fylde Borough.
